entry.title: Pakistan's Flood Losses Deal Crushing Blow to Ailing Economy
entry.content: The disaster is expected to cost Pakistan at least $30 billion, wipe out growth and cause acute food shortages, threatening to push the country into default.

entry.title: Ukraine Battles Flooding After Russian Strike on Dam
entry.content: Ukrainian authorities said they had managed to stave off flooding caused by a Russian missile strike on the southern city of Kryviy Rih, as their forces consolidated their positions in recently retaken areas.

entry.title: Mourners Line Up for Miles to Say Goodbye to the Queen
entry.content: As the coffin of Queen Elizabeth II lay in state at Westminster Hall, a line of people stretched for more than four miles along the River Thames waiting to view it. In a nation that has perfected the art of waiting in line, it was a queue fit for a queen.
